problem: Find the integer $n,$ $-90 \le n \le 90,$ such that $\sin n^\circ = \sin 1021^\circ.$
solution:
Since the sine function has period $360^\circ,$
\[\sin 1021^\circ = \sin (1021^\circ - 3 \cdot 360^\circ) = \sin (-59^\circ),\]so $n = \boxed{-59}.$
wolframquery: Query: sin(x) = sin(1021) and -90 <= x <= 90, solve for x
gptanswer:
Since $\sin n^\circ = \sin (180^\circ - n^\circ),$ we have
\[\sin 1021^\circ = \sin (1021^\circ - 2 \cdot 180^\circ) = \sin (-139^\circ).\]Since $-90^\circ \le -139^\circ \le 90^\circ,$ the answer is $\boxed{-139}.$
